title: Java Methods
subject: Java
theory:
A method is a block of code which only runs when it is called.
You can pass data, known as parameters, into a method.
Methods are used to perform certain actions, and they are also known as **functions**.

common_mistakes.mistake: Calling non-static method from static main
common_mistakes.correction: You cannot call an instance method directly from a static context. Create an object first.

interview_questions.question: Can Java return multiple values?
interview_questions.answer: No. But you can return an Object, Array, or a Collection to simulate receiving multiple values.

practice_problems.problem: Write a method `isEven(int n)` returning boolean.

real_world_use_cases.description: Extracting duplicate code into methods makes code maintainable.

exam_notes: Method signature = Name + Parameter Types (Return type is NOT part of signature).
